definition: wheel/disk/ring/steamship/to take turns/to rotate/by turn/classifier for big round objects: disk, or recurring events: round, turn
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade
see 風水輪流轉|风水轮流转[feng1 shui3 lun2 liu2 zhuan4]

sentences.english: The men alternated leading and lying on their backs and kicking.
sentences.chinese: 所有人轮流领游和倚靠在别人背上蹬划。

sentences.english: We took turns pumping out the boat.
sentences.chinese: 我们轮流用泵把船里的水抽干。

sentences.english: We drank cheap Shancheng Beer, we joked around, we took turns singing songs.
sentences.chinese: 我们喝了廉价的山城啤酒，我们开玩笑，轮流唱歌。

sentences.english: My younger sister and I alternated in doing the dishes.
sentences.chinese: 我妹妹和我轮流洗盘碟。

sentences.english: Parent with child (age 0-4) is required to assist in child care service on rotation basis.
sentences.chinese: 零至四岁的家长请协助轮流看顾小孩服务。

sentences.english: Joe and Dan were the captains. The chose up sides.
sentences.chinese: 乔和丹是队长，他俩轮流挑选各自需要的队员。

sentences.english: During the trip, Darlene and I took turns driving so that neither of us would tire out.
sentences.chinese: 旅途中，达伦和我轮流开车，这样才不会有人累垮。

sentences.english: The children were taking turns on the slides in the playground.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在操场上轮流滑滑梯。

sentences.english: The fuel shortage and rolling power cuts have already crippled industrial production.
sentences.chinese: 燃油短缺和轮流限电的措施已经影响到了工业生产。

sentences.english: My feet took turns kicking at the thick snow, making a dull squeaking sound.
sentences.chinese: 我的脚轮流踩在厚厚的雪地上，发出单调的吱吱声。

sentences.english: He ate his dinner in turn at the homes of six friends. In each home the children begged him for stories.
sentences.chinese: 他轮流在六个朋友家吃饭，每家的孩子都求他讲故事。

sentences.english: Picasso and the poet Max Jacob, down but not out in Paris, shared abed in turn.
sentences.chinese: 毕加索和诗人雅科布在巴黎近郊轮流睡一张床。

sentences.english: As a kid, she alternated days doing dish-washing duty with her big brother, Craig.
sentences.chinese: 小时候，她与哥哥克雷格轮流洗碗。

sentences.english: Players take turns placing pieces on the board.
During the day, too, occupants rotate house-sitting duties.
sentences.chinese: 而白天，他们也轮流值班守护。

sentences.english: The cows are standing in line for a turn at the robot.
sentences.chinese: 奶牛们正排着队等着轮流使用机器人。

definition: to change shift/the next work shift/to relieve (a workman on the previous shift)/to take over the job
to nurse/to look after/to watch over/(old) hospital nurse
to look after/to attend to/to have in care
to serve as/to act as/to play the role of
to keep watch/to do sentry duty/to be on patrol
